javadoc:
A class for storing the new-executable resource table.
 A resource table contains all of the supported types
 of resources.

methods.name: <init>

params.name: index
params.comment:
the byte index where the Resource Table begins,
               (this is relative to the beginning of the file

methods.name: getAlignmentShiftCount
methods.comment:
Returns the alignment shift count. 
 Some resources offsets and lengths are stored bit shifted.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the array of resource types.
@return the array of resource types
methods.name: getResourceTypes
methods.comment: Returns the array of resource types.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the array of resources names.
@return the array of resources names
methods.name: getResourceNames
methods.comment: Returns the array of resources names.

methods.name: getIndex
methods.comment:
Returns the byte index where the resource table begins,
 relative to the beginning of the file.

return.comment: the byte index where the resource table begins

name: ResourceTable
comment:
A class for storing the new-executable resource table.
 A resource table contains all of the supported types
 of resources.
